intro: Lesquerella lunellii var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are used in various industrial applications. Lesquerella lunellii var. lutea typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and agricultural studies.
